instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMBUS_SMC_0_S0_SDA: What is SMBUS_SMC_0_S0_SDA? SMBUS_SMC_0_S0_SDA is a data line between the system management controller(SMC), temperature sensors, GPU, and ALS(ambient light sensor). If this line is pulled down the machine may run slow or have the fans run fast all the time because the SMC canâ€™t tell what the temperature of parts of the machine like fin stack are. Usual problem is bad webcam, unplug webcam to see if it fixes problem. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> chime no video or backlight
threads.message:
Hi All.
Thia is liquid dmg board near LCD Connector. I have replaced the LCD connector and <CHIP>U8300</CHIP> as it was not looking good. 

I dont get any voltage on data lines in <RESISTOR>R8361</RESISTOR>, <RESISTOR>R8362</RESISTOR>.  Also <SIGNAL>EDP_PANEL_PWR</SIGNAL> is 0v. I cheked the LCD pins in diod mode and it seems ok with working board connector  reading.

Appreciate your help.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> chime no video or backlight
threads.message:
This is eDP panel, so pins 18/19 of J8300 should get voltage at least in the first few seconds.
Pin 14 must go high in this time.
PCH requires <SIGNAL>DP_INT_HPD</SIGNAL> signal for correct LCD detection.
Check L8304 and traces to <RESISTOR>R5670</RESISTOR>.
Be sure <CHIP>U8300</CHIP> is properly soldered and check for short, or low value to ground, on its pins.

Confirm consistent USB activity.
You hear chime, but board can get stuck there...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> chime no video or backlight
threads.message:
Hi, THank you for your quick reply.

Pins 18,19 of J8300 I get 3v just for a second. L8304 trace to <RESISTOR>R5670</RESISTOR> is fine. tested with ex monitor USB's working fine. Checked the resistors around J8300 they all fine.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> chime no video or backlight
threads.message: <SIGNAL>DP_INT_HPD</SIGNAL> comes high in that second when you get 3V at J8300?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> chime no video or backlight
threads.message: no it doesnt come high in that second .0v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> chime no video or backlight
threads.message:
Check if <RESISTOR>R8360</RESISTOR> is OK.
Be sure to have good traces and solders for J8300.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> chime no video or backlight
threads.message: I replaced <RESISTOR>R8360</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R8350</RESISTOR> as 8350 was 50k. I placed and check <RESISTOR>R8350</RESISTOR> was 98k. then powered and same as before. Then I checked <RESISTOR>R8350</RESISTOR> again and its 50k.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> chime no video or backlight
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> chime no video or backlight
threads.message:
"<RESISTOR>R8350</RESISTOR> again and its 50k."
Onboard measurement is not relevant in this case.
High value resistor is affected by other components.

Do you get external video?
Try disconnecting LCD and give time to enter OSX...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> chime no video or backlight
threads.message: HI, it works with external display. boot couple of times with osx . replaced the LCD connector again. Replaced SMC thinking <SIGNAL>SMBUS_SMC_0_S0_SDA</SIGNAL> AND SCL pulling down. none of worked. still the same situation. should i get 3.3v with out the LCD on <RESISTOR>R8362</RESISTOR> &<RESISTOR>R8361</RESISTOR> coz I cheked with a working board it stays for a while. but this board just for half a sec.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> chime no video or backlight
threads.message:
Normally 3V3 should stay few seconds, without LCD connected.
Replace all the caps from the liquid affected area.
Also check for corrosion all resistors.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> chime no video or backlight
threads.message:
Hi Solved. Thank you so much for your guidance. As you said I replaced all the caps affected area still was the same. Then I replaced the <CAPACITOR>C8320</CAPACITOR>,<CAPACITOR>C8321</CAPACITOR>,<RESISTOR>R8318</RESISTOR>,<RESISTOR>R8317</RESISTOR>. Display works.
Another successful guidance by 2informatics. Thank you Sir.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> chime no video or backlight
threads.message: Just to know is <SIGNAL>DP_INT_ML_C</SIGNAL> and P required to create <SIGNAL>DP_INT_HDP</SIGNAL>?
